title: NEOVIM
description: At the beginning of 2024, I gave myself the goal of moving over to Neovim full-time by the end of the year. I'm happy to report that 2025 has been a year full of Neovim! The reason I wanted to make this switch was to learn more about LSPs, linters, debuggers, formatters, and other low-level IDE configurations. I've learned a lot and made tons of changes to my setup—check out my latest Neovim config below.

title: Advent of Code
description: I'll be honest—I'm not great at solving Advent of Code problems. I've always found them a bit challenging, especially under time pressure. I ended up skipping the 2024 event entirely, but it's something I want to come back to. Hopefully in 2025, I can carve out more time and make it farther than I ever have before. I'm looking forward to using it as a chance to sharpen my problem-solving skills and have some fun along the way.

title: Tech Write Up
description: I made this as a study guide for students I was working with around 2 years ago. At the time, I wanted to start blogging regular programming language breakdowns like this one, but I never found the time or motivation to move past JavaScript. I've been considering coming back to this at some point.

title: CreeperKeeper
description: CreeperKeeper is a project I began in May 2024 and continue to update in my free time. It's an open source Minecraft server management service designed to be simple and cost-efficient—ideal for short play sessions with friends. Instead of paying for a full month, you just click a button and pay for what you use. As of June 2025, it’s functional but not yet scalable.
